intro: Elionurus euchaetus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant features slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in dense clusters and bloom during the cooler months. Elionurus euchaetus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
